On the wall over Zabel's shoulder runs an electronic ticker with the major indices and just one stock... ticker KZI... Keller Zabel Investments.I thought that because of the problems with the credi--Are you okay? Zabel doesn't answer... he just nods to the envelope.Thank you. And we get a good look at Jacob now... boyish features that display humility with a trace of mischievousness thrown in. He's definitely sexy, definitely cerebral and definitely winning.Yeah, it's nice. But here's the thing... He looks around the store for a moment, then...I want to see the "fuck you" room.Yes. The room where you sell me a fuck you ring for fuck you money.What did I say?Yeah, let's get closer to home. A trader named AUDRY turns to Jacob.The stock goes down, you wear the crown... them's the rules. Audry grins in victory. Willy shakes his head, grabs a marker, scribbles something down on a post-it then places it on his forehead. It reads "I bought Toll Brothers at $24" and he has to wear it all week. And Jacob laughs... now looking up at the electronic ticker... KZI $60.21... -$2.25...Getting priced out of the hooker bubble? Confirming in frustration...Why? Private Equity CFO nudges Hedge Fund PM in reference to the woman who just took the seat at the next table...Why? Why are you so shocked? Offering Jacob a flute...We're not in serious trouble. It's a rumor. A woman takes the table next to them and this makes Derivatives Trader perk up and say.Whatever, somebody was adding to their short. As a supermodel now joins the next table.Can I ask you something, Robby? Robby nods.What's your number?You know what I mean. The amount of money you would need to fuck it all and walk away... if you wanted to.Not now. But one day... I don't know. When I have a family. It's just so consuming... so many marriages getExactly.Last week.I'm going to DC this weekend.Sour grapes.Tell me what you hear. Robby slowly nods...I don't worship him. He's done a lot for me and I've known him a long time. But he's been acting strange lately.It's not true. It's rumors. There are hedge funds with huge short positions...I don't remember. Turning to Jacob with...I said that? Robby confirms... then...Diego...I don't know.I'm here to see Andrew Zabel.No.Andy. I'm sorry to come by like this but the rumors are now hitting a fever pitch and I wanted to make sure everything was okay. Zabel nods and heads for the door.Is everything okay? And Andrew Zabel doesn't seem all there... introspective and blank.What's going on?Andy, are we going under?Flour Controls. Are you okay? Zabel laughs.Why did you give me that bonus? Zabel stops walking and faces Jacob with...There isn't a better money-runner on the street... we'll get through this.Andrew, if there's anyway I can help -- give back the bonus -- whatever... all you have to do is say the word. And Zabel just looks away...Stunned... horrified... his universe becoming unglued. And he turns to Audry... helpless and in shock.Who did this to us? She can only shrug... tears in her eyes. Jacob shifts his gaze over to the trading floor's electronic ticker on the wall... KZI $26.34... -$29.57. And he moves for the elevator banks... unable to take it anymore.Andrew, call me back. I'm going to find out who did this to us. I swear to God... if it's the last thing I do.What? From the door...It broke. Robby sharply nods.What?What? Robby, what are you trying to say?Mr. Gekko, can I speak to you for a moment? As he keeps walking...My name is Jacob Moore and I'm dating your daughter.Yeah...Andrew Zabel took me under his wing when I was in high school. He basically got me my scholarship to Yale then hired me right out of business school.He's dead. And Gordon stops walking and regards Jacob. Who confirms...He killed himself this morning. As that registers...He was a father to me.I love your daughter very much and I would be honored if... And realizing what this is... Gordon starts to laugh... which throws Jacob off.... you would bless-- I really don't understand what you find so funny.What?Yes.Matinecock.It wasn't like that. I mean we didn't have much money. My mother was a tailor.Disappear. And Gordon regards Jacob for a long moment, taking him in, until...Your town car. With a laugh...Can I... have it?You... wanna make a trade? And Gordon thinks about, then...I don't have one on me. Gordon sighs, takes the picture out of his wallet and hands it to Jacob.I really did come to ask for your blessing.Smell what on me?You knew he was dead? "Guardian Mortgage... Low down payments... Adjustable rates."I know who.It was either Nassim Tariq from the Frontier Fund, Bretton Woods from Locust or Karen Molina from ESL.Well, not exactly.I'm going to bring them down. Whoever floated the rumor for a quick buck.My mother was a tailor. They all look at him.Out of our house less than five miles from here.We weren't rich. Everyone else was.He gave me a seat at the table. ... and goes.I was a fucked up kid, I was angry, my mother couldn't control me. He was the only one who cared. I wouldn't be anywhere right now if it wasn't for... And Jacob Moore stops short... finally breaking down... allowing his own tears to stream down his face. He pulls away...If you need anything. She nods. And Jacob moves away from the people and moves across the lawn. But he stops when he sees a woman standing across the way... we've seen pictures of her. She's in her late-twenties with a natural beauty that might take two glances to notice. But after that second glance... it's unforgettable. She's WINNIE GEKKO. As she rushes to him...Lehigh had the committee hearings and I knew he would need you and I didn'tWill you marry me?I got a ring. Not on me, but--Yeah.I had a whole thing I was going to do in DC but seeing you... the words just kind of fell out of my mouth... I don't know.By the way, I don't have a job anymore.Yeah...No.We're not taking it back. I worked hard for that ring and I want you to wear it. She regards him... he's serious.Hey Audry. She looks up.You cover pharm and biotech.Who are the big players in diabetes treatments?Is anyone riding on something in phase three?How did they die?Pancreatitis?How did he know?Can you look up large institutional ownership?Hedge.Want your severance, Audry? And he kisses her on the forehead...Short Amlyn pharmaceuticals. ... and goes.I don't know exactly but it's not something you wanna come down with.Any day now.A doctor that's very close to the trials... and that's all I can say.But listen, I'm out of work now so I can't afford to get behind size on this trade... I'm only telling you because you've helped me in the past.This is completely off the record. So please...... don't tell anyone.Your boy's coming up in the polls. Senator Lehigh nods.Her father. What's the word he uses... systemic. Winnie looks over to Jacob.On Charlie Rose.He's going to win. As she hands him the glass of water...Whatever you want. Her phone rings. As she goes to answer it...Not Project Runway. Picking up the phone...I'm here to see Bretton Woods. The butler nods then leads Jacob through the full floor unit and into the...Do you collect?Your daughter's an amazing piano player. That was quite a show.No.A doctor I know. Bretton nods... regards him.That's right.You destroyed my firm.You killed Andrew Zabel.You made them true.What?Why me?You can have my answer now, Bretton... I have no interest in working for a fund that's in trouble. Bretton smiles...What's your number?The amount of money you would need to be able to walk away from it all and just live happily-ever-after.I know you're going to tell me... Diego smiles...Not bad...Oh...Okay.Just not hungry.I actually owe you one now. Off Gordon's look...I crushed him.His fund is bleeding. I wouldn't be surprised if the redemptions finish the job.How'd you know about Amlyn? Gordon shrugs.So, you didn't use me to make a little money? And never to look up from his lunch...Why'd you give it to me?I didn't make any money off of it.That would've been insider trading, Mr. Gekko. Gordon just shakes his head.And not "most likely."Good guess.Bretton offered to hire me.Fuck no. Jacob now finds himself looking at a political cartoon from the early 1900s. It's of two men rowing a boat in a lake of dollars. One of the men is Uncle Sam dressed in US flag colors. But Sam's very small in this cartoon... can't really row the boat. The other man is much bigger and clearly doing the heavy rowing. He is...That's horrifying.What caused it?And you honestly think this is where we're heading? Looking Jacob head on... deadly serious...Hudson River Bank...What are you talking about?How do you know that?I can't believe it.And you think I should take the job -- bring him down from the inside? Gordon confirms that with a simple shake of the head and...Robby, I need to know. Now nobody moves size in this town without using your desk.Bretton Woods... The Locust Fund... did they make any major moves in the last few weeks?Was it unloading Amlyn pharmaceuticals?Robby, I got you the fucking the job! And after a long moment.I'm sorry to make you do that. With that, he disconnects and shakes his head in frustration. And after a moment, Jacob sucks in a deep breath then makes another call.Okay Gordon... you've got yourself a trade.What'd he do?I think he should be invited to the wedding.Winnie, he's your father... As the fireworks explode into their finale...I know he's unhappy. Look at him out there... trying to scare everybody. He's desperate for attention."That's not how this works." Remember? She just looks away...He's got nothing. The firework show ends and everyone applauds...It was a long time ago. He stands and kisses her...Just consider it, okay? That's all I'm asking. She holds his look for a long moment, then... nodding over to all the excitement...Mr. Woods.Okay... Bretton. I thought we were going to meet in New York.I was emotional. I was angry.I caught a glance of my portfolio.Cute dogs.You named your dogs after technical futures market terms? And Bretton stands...And where are your children? Bretton moves toward a table with a classic phonograph player on it.An asset's value can only be priced at its perception.Thank you.That's right.He's going to Dubai to raise some money then meeting me in New York to set me up. Gordon sits at the dining room table at his apartment. Papers scattered about and his EDITOR waiting patiently.What?Why not?I don't understand.Looks better than meals I get on United.Well -- there's a lot I can learn from you.I don't understand. Is he resigning?What'd he do? And Bretton simply turns to him and says...Oleg, I'm Jacob Moore. It's nice to meet you. Oleg regards Jacob for a beat, then back to Bretton and asks again...That's right.I couldn't agree more, Oleg. It's one of the first things that Andrew Zabel taught me. I worked very closely with him. It's why Bretton hired me. To get behind the Andrew Zabel curtain. Bretton flashes Jacob a look... "What the hell are you doing?" Jacob swallows back some nerves then continues...You said before that you always wanted to invest with Zabel but couldn't because he only handled institutional money. Well here's your chance. Zabel taught me everything he knew. Oleg looks up to Jacob from the line of coke with interest.Well, I'm not going to give you the whole cake, Oleg... He looks over to Bretton who still glares at Jacob...But I can give you a little bite...It's complicated but like Bretton said -- right now there are more opportunities than ever. Oleg simply nods... with a simple...What party?Come in.No... not there...No... I want you to hold it. And find the three of them...I know... but if you're going to correctly utilize this technical head and shoulders strategy, you need to hold the stock until... ... right here.Very common mistake. You need to cut your losers short and let your winners run. She looks to her friend with a smile...Okay. I think enough time has passed. I appreciate you guys keeping our little secret.I do. Jacob opens the door to let them go but he hears a door open across the hall... Bretton's. And they all witness a YOUNGER AMERICAN WOMAN leave Bretton's room then head down the hall right by them. Jacob's stunned.Is she a gift from Oleg?No Bretton. That was all bullshit.I think so. Travel the park to find... Jacob and Gordon stopping at the food vendors.Oh... I'm still working on it.Whatever. And they trade. The hotdog for the pretzel.Is that a threat? Looking Jacob dead on...You're priceless, Gordon.What bad position?Financials.Bring it. Diego smiles... loves this new one...Tell me.Why are you with me? She stops and turns back to him.You hate finance. You hate Wall Street. Why are you with me? Winnie nods. It's a valid question. And she thinks about it for a moment, then...Huh?And what does it mean, psych major?Like when children of alcoholics fall in love with alcoholics.That's great, Winnie.Nothing... As Jacob draws in a deep breath, collects himself and finally turns back to her with...I just wish you would master that relationship from childhood so you can move forward with this one.Bretton... I found something I like. Bretton looks over to him.I just wanted to make sure I would be bringing you the smartest idea possible. I know you don't go light. Confirming...It might be better to do this in the office. I have color and support toAnd we're allowed to ride these through here? Sucking in the fresh summer air...Okay. I'm just getting used to it.Here?Right. Okay.I think it's time to go the other way.Insurance companies. I'm talking the old school insurers that have become the babies thrown out with the bath water. Jacob waits for a reaction from Bretton. But all he gets is...The basket of stocks I'm putting together focuses on reinsurance brokering and management services for businesses. They're trading below book and have large dividends.I'm not arguing that... but the best opportunities are found where angels fear to tread. Jacob can see... he has Bretton on the hook.So yeah -- they are falling knives. But Bretton... And with confidence... driving it home...... what's life without a little blood on your hands?You're going to be fine.No. You're doing this for you. She just glares at him.Then what my friends say about marriage will be true.Mr. Gekko, I'm Jacob Moore, we spoke on the phone. Nice to finally meet in person. Gekko just looks at him for an extra long beat, then... shakes his hand.I don't drink.Winnie... Winnie... He turns her around.Your brother's dead, Winnie.Your father isn't.It was a long time ago. She pulls out of his embrace...I love you. You don't have to do this.Yes.Bretton.Okay. Good. It's just a matter of time before they turn. I'll call theOkay.He's chasing. Suddenly, a MAN approaches the table. He's in his thirties.How do we know the insurance companies are going to continue going down? As he casually places his egg on a piece of toast...To be rich... is to have the love of a good woman. They all boo...For real... I truly believe that. And Jacob turns to Bretton...Bretton... what's your definition of rich? An approaching voice answers it for him.We have a proactive central bank, the charts show a clear bottom on July 15th and these companies are trading at half of what they were six months ago.I read your book.I have a friend in publishing.Really Gordon? Do you really need attention that badly?It's capitulation. Bretton holds Jacob's look... fighting to keep his composure. Until... he simply stands and offers Jacob his desk back.Right. Bretton just stares nervously at the electronic ticker... a frazzled gambler talking himself into his bet.I'm sorry, you have an early train. I'm going to just go to the office now. She leans up.It's not the market, Winnie. As he sits on the edge of the bed...It's just that I haven't been able to sleep through the night since... The thought trails off... she leans up and kisses him.Go back to sleep. And he goes... After a beat, she sees Jacob's wallet.What happened to composure, Bretton?What?You still have six hundred million? Bretton vacantly nods. And Jacob Moore... trying his best to hide his disappointment...That's a fortune. With a shrug...He wants to close the fund... he wants to ride off into the fucking sunset...No, it's not okay... because we're so fucking close... and he's going to walk with six hundred million dollars and that's unacceptable. And Gordon sighs in defeat...What happened to slaughtering men, Gordon? What happened to turning them into penny-ante brokers in Poughkeepsie? Gordon stops walking.I want to finish the job.Because nobody gave a shit about me before Andrew Zabel came along. Because he didn't deserve what he got.Did you? Now it's Gordon who looks away.What's that supposed to mean?I'm sorry she doesn't want anything to do with you, Gordon -- I'm sorry she doesn't love you! Gordon stops walking. Turns...No...You're lying.I know. But I do have something for you... And as Morgan Portfolio Manager leans forward in anticipation...So I heard something earlier today...Not to mention expensive.So, you've obviously heard the rumor? And Blogger looks over to Jacob... he hasn't.United Bancorp is going under. Wells Fargo has stepped up but the offer is insanely low.You still have the fund and you still have the leverage that comes with it. You want out of the game... buy a bank. Bretton skeptically regards Jacob.Because I got you into those insurance companies... because I let you down... And Bretton... biting his lip in thought...I worked it out already. You wouldn't have to take it.Well, Wells won't insure the Zabel institutional money. It's against their policy. And then...I told them you would.Uncle Sam. Bretton slowly nods... taking all this in...You could actually own the bank your father toiled away at his whole career. Think about that, Bretton. Bretton just shakes his head.So in order to stay in the game... we need fresh money. Bretton nods...And how much do we need?Sit tight. I'm going to get us the money. And Jacob goes... Bretton calling out after him...He's going for it. We're almost home. As he signs it...But he needs fresh money to serve the leverage. A hundred million. Gordon just shrugs.I know that, but I figured you might know how to get it. Handing Jacob back the signed copy...How much?But it is... right? It's your money? And she faces him... regarding his urgency...I'm not kidding. This is important. As they continue to walk...Let's say I can figure out a way for you to get it. Jacob nods.But our deal with Gordon was that we have to stay short until November 5th. Bretton just looks at him.What?No. No, everything's great. Confused...So we're throwing Bretton's birthday party at Balmoral.That's funny because he often speaks about his days here at Redmayne and Bentley... anyway, what I'm hoping you can help me with were records of his early trades. Years ago.I completely understand. How about this? I'll make you a trade.... and I'll make sure Bretton gives your young brokers a speech that will blow them away.Wow, Bretton -- you really kicked some ass for client forty one. I want you to tell Bretton you need the official records of all the fund's activity starting with when you gave him the original two hundred million. He moves to the curtains then opens them. And the daylight spills in.They were working together. Your father and Bretton. Walking back into the apartment...Gordon wanted the trust the whole time. And when I came to him seeking revenge... he saw his window. Upset, she looks for her keys.Bretton owed him a favor because he fed your father information twenty three years ago when he was a young broker in London and your father never ratted him out. She just looks at him... shaking her head... and not in disapproval... but in pity. But he keeps going.And he never put the money into Bretton's fund. Turns out your trust had built up a controlling position in Hudson River Bank.Well, now he owns it. Or shall I say pilfered it before he went AWOL.He saw this coming years ago... from his cell. I'm guessing he made off with billions. And he throws something on the table.And now look?He's in London... giving interviews and being hailed as a genius. Everyone's buying his book and waiting to see his next move. Desperately trying to get her mind around this...The government is flying this 700 billion dollar airplane by the seat of it's pants. They don't know where half of the fucking money is going. And even if they did, do you think they want this out there? As this all washes over her...Yup... sure beats the hell out of insider trading, doesn't it? And Winnie finds her keys and heads for the door...I'm done. I sold everything. The ring. Everything. I gave back the KZI bonus. I'm out and I'm broke and I deserve it. And she just looks at him...But Winnie, the one thing I can't accept -- is losing you. And before she reacts...You finally got the cover. Gordon nods.Everybody thinks you got rich of betting against the system. If they only knew...How much is enough, Gordon? Gordon laughs with a shake of the head.You're not going to miss America?What happened to the precious depreciating asset of time?I'm out, Gordon, I'm done trading.Did you ever really want to reconcile with her?Then why did you do it? And Gordon... strongly holding Jacob's glare... simply replies...But it didn't work. Gordon sadly shrugs...I know. She doesn't want it... we don't want it.Winnie's pregnant. And Gordon stops walking.It's going to be a boy.It's bad out there, Gordon, people are panicked. They're not looking to their government. They're not looking to their trusted advisors. They're looking to you.Publicly and aggressively. Gordon just looks at him.But they're all lemmings. Simple psychology. You once said every crash should have a JP Morgan to step in and save it.It'll buy us time. That's all I'm asking for... time.Full clemency.Your daughter can. She works with the new Secretary of Treasury now. Considering that...Winnie. Me. Your grandson. Something money can't buy... a family. And Gordon looks at him for the longest moments, allowing it all to register, then...

No good deed goes unpunished, all fires start with a well meaning spark and we wanted Americans to be able to afford homes. Sounds nice enough... lets try to get the middle and lower classes into homes they can own. So we made money cheap and lowered restrictions on mortgage lending. As he takes a moment and looks over the room...Somebody reminded me the other night that I once said "greed is good." I swear I don't remember it but it sounds like something I would say in the Eighties.So greed has been redefined. Who knows -- maybe it was always like this and like everything else in this world, it's good and it is evil. Taking a moment to survey the room...Because people -- it's greed that caused someone who aspires to own a seven-hundred thousand dollar house they can't afford, to take on a loan they'll never be able to pay back... and it's greed that caused their mortgage lender to give them that loan then sell it right away... and it's greed that caused the buyer of that loan to slice it into a million little pieces then spit them all over the world... and it's greed that caused the rating agency to give that toxic loan a triple-A rating just because it was mixed in with some good loans... and it's greed that caused the insurance company to insure that loan. Jacob quickly glances down again at his blackberry and checks the quote, KZI $14.53.They were insuring the end of the world; "When the world explodes... just find us in the rubble and we'll be sure to pay your claim." Drawing in a deep breath...CMO's, CLO's, CBO's, CDO's, CDS's, SPE's, ABCP's,SIV's, REMIC's, CMBS's, toxic traunches, ninja loans, credit default swaps, affinity marketing, stapled financing, synthetic securitization.And I'm considered a pretty smart guy when it comes to finance! And Jacob's blackberry vibrates again. This time he removes it from his pocket, doesn't check it and simply turns it off.And if I know our central bank -- which I do -- I predict it's going to throw gasoline on this fire with more cheap money and federal bailouts andSo no good deed goes unpunished and all fires start with a well-meaning spark and when you take free money and no lending standards then add it with unaccountable risk and ungodly leverage and unbridled greed... what you end up with is cancer. Jacob laughs...He rented a barge and shot the fireworks off of it a mile off the coast... out of jurisdiction. The show was even more amazing over the water. And Jacob looks at her.No.You don't know him.This is none of your business.And that's what he deserves. Suddenly, everyone begins to look over to the house where something is happening...The things that came out after he was convicted. The affairs... the things he was recorded saying... SECRET SERVICE PERSONNEL, wearing ear pieces, start walking the lawn.This wasn't the man we knew, Jacob. It was... sociopathic. She moves to him.I love you because you're compassionate and you care so deeply about what you do and you have like no ego, it's crazy. She reaches to him... turning his face to meet hers.And you're the smartest person I've ever met... and there's nobody I trust more in the world. Jacob looks away... almost ashamed. He takes her hand.I'm only doing this for you.We're never having sex again.Oh, shut up.Hey. They just stand there. Jacob holds out his hand.I'm not really hungry.Yeah. She's really been... very... supportive of my... And it trails off... as she just glares at Gordon.I can't do this. She exhales, stands and looks down to Jacob.I'm sorry. I can't do this. I couldn't help him. Jacob takes her into his hold...He's not the person people think he is.He'll hurt us. Can't we just go home? Please... Jacob. It's raining. Jacob turns to see she's awake.He didn't want to keep my mother awake so he'd go into the kitchen and sit there. I could hear him because my room was right up the back stairs. (shaking her head in... you've become him.Jacob, what are you doing here? Following her in...I have to go to work.That's the bank he worked at when I was born.Jesus... BRETTON WOODS.raw_line: As you can see, I'm having a little dinner party here but I thought it was important we speak right away. He speaks with a British accent.. Jacob nods. Bretton looks over the room for a moment, scans his guests then back at Jacob...Please... if you don't mind waiting in my office, I'll be in a minute. And the butler is already at Jacob's side, motioning him to follow him.Saturno devorando a sus hijos. As Jacob turns to see Bretton standing in the doorway.Saturn devouring his son. Francisco Goya. Bretton heads in and closes the door behind him.No. Sitting behind his desk...Only the obsessive compulsive or the insecure egotistical feel the need to collect things. Jacob nods. Bretton just looks at him... making him nervous.That wasn't my daughter. That was Isabel Patrovsky, she's the world's greatest living piano prodigy.You cost my fund three hundred and forty million dollars today. Off of Jacob's slight smile...Yeah, kills my year, pushes my watermark higher and might cause redemptions.You don't want to deny it?Who told you?I checked with all the desks in town... you didn't make money off it.Then why did you do it?Your firm destroyed itself.Andrew Zabel killed himself. And Bretton sighs...The rumors were true.No, Jacob, being levered thirty-eight to one in toxic debt made them true.His fatal flaw was allowing the children on his mortgage security desk to talk him into the deadly game of hot potato everybody's been so fond of playing recently. And Jacob holds Bretton's look for a moment, then... heads for the door without saying a thing...Come work for me. Jacob stops and turns...I run three billion dollars. Come help me run it. And Jacob takes a beat... processing this...Because your loyalty desired revenge, your balls actually attempted it and your skills pulled it off. As he stands...And as for Andrew Zabel... there really is no telling why he did what he did.Now I'm going on Safari with my family. Think about the offer and get in touch after the July 4th holiday. ... heading for the door...You got my attention, Jacob... and that's one of the rarest commodities out there. And Jacob just regards him, then...Touche. Jacob nods... holding Bretton's look. Then...Excuse me?More. ... and disappears into his penthouse.Jacob. As Jacob walks through the expansive space...Bretton. ... and sits.And I thought you had no interest in working for a fund that was in trouble.And what changed?Dogue de Bordeaux... bred to kill. But Contango and Backwardation here are socialized since birth so they're harmless. Jacob laughs...Of course not... My children did. As he heads into...Greece with my wife. My boys are studying The Iliad now. While Bretton looks through the various sleeves of records, Contango and Backwardation slowly find their way into the room and sit by the fire. Bretton finds what he's looking for... removing the record from its sleeve.Here it is... one of the most beautiful pieces of music you'll ever hear. Bretton places the record on the phonograph and The Rolling Stones "Let It Loose" rings out..."Exile On Main Street," without a doubt The Stones greatest album. Jacob laughs. He was expecting Beethoven.It was all outtakes. Throwaway tracks. And the critics hated it. And it didn't sell well at first.And that was the greatest lesson I ever learned about investing.You'll work out of the New York office. I wouldn't want to pull you away from your fiancee in Washington.She's Gordon Gekko's daughter.He was a legend at one time. It's quite sad how he publicly cries out wolf now. Bretton stands and stretches.You see, for a legend...... the only thing worse than death is becoming irrelevant. And Bretton just sits there... enjoying his scotch while taking in the Stones tune...John's Pizza on Bleeker. It crossed the Atlantic with you yesterday. Would you like a slice? Jacob declines... then...I appreciate you wanting to help with this part of the business even though it's not your expertise.For this trip just stay in the background and observe. As Bretton tosses some pizza to Contango and Backwardation...We're going to meet with Oleg Bakunin. He's a Russian oligarch on the run because Putin wanted to steal everything he owns. He already has a few hundred million with us but I'm looking to get half a billion more. Our maintenance fee on that alone would be ten million a year.He worked in a mid-level job for United Bancorp actually...Got a fishing kit when he retired.Richard Branson purchased Great Britain, Rod Stewart bought Germany, Tommy Lee bought Greece.Looks like a bit of news broke while we were in the air... And Bretton turns on Fox Business to see footage of... The Governor of New York standing at a podium next to his WIFE. He doesn't look happy as he says...He's been after us for years...Oh Jacob... you don't want to live in a glass house if you're gonna play this game.Yes sir.Outsourced.There's a big party for Oleg tonight at a club called The Left Bank. It's Roaring 20s themed so I've had original suits from that era delivered to our rooms.Remember. Hedge funds are not banking and this isn't Ivy-league-geography- ninth-hole deal making.Oleg's a brute, he's has A.D.D. and he likes to party. As they stop in front of large double doors... the BELLMAN opens the doors to reveal...I'm just down the hall. I hope you don't mind I took the nicer one.If he offers you a drink -- take it. And with that, Bretton points across the room where OLEG BAKUNIN sits.If he offers you a line of coke -- snort it. He's in his mid-40s, overweight, sweaty, draped in tight black Prada and smoking a cigarette.If he offers you a child -- raise it. And it seems A MODEL BOMB has recently exploded at Oleg's table... leaving the skinny shards everywhere. Oleg sees them, stands and opens his arms.A hundred and twenty-nine dollars a barrel.Jacob has recently come over from KZI to work with me. And now Oleg turns to Jacob.And hopefully that's just a start. Oleg, there are so many opportunities out there right now I feel like a kid in the candy store. Oleg waves him off.You look like crap. They walk for the exit.Let me ask you something... was that speech about split strike prices and stocks new to volatility for real?Well, it worked. Oleg's wiring us five hundred million dollars today. And Bretton turns to Jacob... impressed.Good job, Jacob... And as they head out into the Dubai heat...I've been wondering when my new portfolio manager was going to come to me with something special.That's right. If I commit to this... we go large and we don't back down.C'mon Jacob, you know that's not how we do.This is how we do. And with a nod, the DRIVER of the other jetvan opens it to reveal two motorcycles inside. Bretton's MTT Turbine Superbike and an Agusta, these bikes are handcrafted works of art as much as they are demons of speed. Jacob laughs in disbelief and excitement.No.Follow me... And with that, shoots into the forest. Jacob quickly follows.You're going to have to keep up.Tell me your idea.Where else?No. After KZI, I took profits.Banks?Keep up! And with that, Bretton rips into the clearing. Jacob rides just as fast. They're neck and neck... it's definitely a race. Bretton pulls ahead but Jacob doesn't give up. As they move quickly toward a patch of forest with a only narrow trail entering it, Jacob focuses on the horizon and revs the bike into more speed. He pulls up next to Bretton as they approach the trail. If Jacob doesn't slow down, and fall in line behind Bretton, he's going to hit the trees. But he doesn't. Instead, Jacob blasts the bike into its final dose of speed, narrowly avoiding impact by zipping into the trail... pulling ahead of Bretton and taking the lead.Financials are a falling knife. Jacob nods...Okay. Then I want you to build positions in your favorite three names. Jacob picks up the phone and...I want you stealth. Use all six trading desks we're in business with.And if they go down... we increase our size.See Jacob -- I don't believe in "wrong." MCC at $21.65, ACN at $16.24 and ISS at $7.23.I only believe in "not right yet."Your insurance companies are down. He's working a coffee in the master suite of The Black Swan Home...I want to increase our size. Glancing at the LCD, 12:23am...Jacob, I want you to triple our positions on all three.And they better fucking go up. Click. And as Jacob just looks at the phone...It's a good question... what do you think, George? GEORGE, an investment banker at the table, thinks about it.Be careful Gordon... ... your daughter's financial health is in my hands now. Jacob loses his smile... suddenly becoming uncomfortable.No, I don't suppose you did. Bretton looks over to Jacob.Go ahead, Jacob, preach your book... defend your names. And Jacob turns to Gordon...They're not going to save it. They're just going to let it bloody die! And sure enough... on the tv... Fox Business runs footage of Lehman Brother's demise. On the screen, the chyron screams:We're getting fucking killed. And Jacob looks up to his electronic ticker...Then buy more. Jacob takes his chair and reaches for the phone.Cost us down to current levels. Jacob looks up, surprised.It's just a question of time before this turns around... right? And he glares at Jacob.Fuck it.Leverage is sexy.Are you happy? He stands in the doorway holding a drink.We're done. And Bretton CHUCKS the drink against the wall and the glass shatters. Jacob takes a step back. Bretton's in a complete state as he walks over to Jacob's desk and SWIPES it clean... papers flying about.Finished... Now he picks up the chair...Bank notices... ... throws it against the window... which cracks.Margin calls... As he punches the monitor of Jacob's Bloomberg...Redemptions... And Jacob just stands there... wide-eyed. Just looking at...Face full of sweat... blood all over his hand... hair strewn about... completely out of breath... bloodshot red eyes... a beaten down mess of a man.Well, I suppose it went to hell with your fucking insurance stocks. And Bretton calms down, walks to the window.It's not making sense to me anymore. The market always made sense to me and for the most part... I was better than it... quicker than it.If I unwind the fund now I'll still walk with six hundred million or so. And Jacob's face falls... this is news to him.It's time to call it a day. Spend more time with my family. I suppose this moment comes for all of us.I guess it's all relative. Bretton then takes a moment... confirming to himself that this is the right decision... then finally looks over to Jacob with...And Jacob -- you're the worst portfolio manager I've ever seen.I don't like unannounced visits.I know all this.Why are you doing this?I don't like the mortgage toxic waste. It can't be quantified... and it spreads...How'd you do that?Then who would take on the mortgage securities?So, I'd get the bank, the KZI assets including the institutional fund yet none of the mortgage securities. As Jacob leans forward... going in for the kill...We're going to lose our credit. I'm facing margin calls.Oil's crashing. Jacob thinks for a moment, then...Fifty, sixty million minimum... and that's just to hold off the current margin calls. And Bretton just sighs...God, de-leveraging is a bitch. Standing...From who... ?The United Bancorp deal is going to go through. I've begun unwinding all our positions.Jacob, Gordon redeemed all his money yesterday. We're clean with him. And this hits Jacob like a ton of bricks...Is something wrong?
